Explanations about Options.--smallfiles:
Enables a mode where MongoDB uses a smaller default file size. Specifically,
 --smallfiles reduces the initial size for data files and limits them to 512
 megabytes. --smallfiles also reduces the size of each journal files from 1 gigabyte
 to 128 megabytes.
Explanations about Options.--port:
Specifies a TCP port for the mongod to listen for client connections. By default
 mongod listens for connections on port 27017.
Explanations about Options.--noprealloc:
Disables the preallocation of data files. This will shorten the start up time in
 some cases, but can cause significant performance penalties during normal
 operations.

Explanations about Options.-s:
Run the shell specified by the SHELL environment variable if it is set or the
 shell specified by the invoking user's password database entry. If a command is
 specified, it is passed to the shell for execution via the shell's -c option.
 If no command is specified, an interactive shell is executed. Note that most
 shells behave differently when a command is specified as compared to an
 interactive session; consult the shell's manual for details.
Explanations about Options.-A:
